author: beringela1311
content:
This maybe isn't the right channel to ask this, but regarding rollups, I've a question about what data lives inside the rollup blob. Does **the rollup blob** generally contain:

1) just the L2 transactions as sent, or
2) the L2 transactions as sent and their on-chain state after L2 mined it, or
3) the L2 transactions as sent and their on-chain state after L2 mined it and the logs emitted on L2, or
4) some other combination?

Maybe it isn't possible to generalise but I'd like to get the idea

author: bridge-bot
content:
<ralexstokes> any blob consumer gets to decide the semantics of the actual data in the blob -- as far as L1 is concerned, it is just 'flat' bytes with no higher level structure

some rollups put the txns themselves in the blob, some rollups put state diffs in the blob -- either can be used to apply against the prestate and get to the post state

you would generally want to be efficient with data usage so you'd want to drive towards the minimal required data to allow anyone to compute from pre -> post
